title: Chapter 2 - A Tale of Two Values

cells.data:
"I have two kinds of problems, the urgent and the important. The urgent are not important, and the important are never urgent." — Dwight D. Eisenhower

In order:
1. Urgent and important
2. Not urgent and important
3. Urgent and not important
4. Not urgent and not important

Don't swap 2 and 3, and don't confuse 3 with 1! Technical people can evaluate architectural needs better than business people - it's literally our trade.

If architecture is deprioritized, changes over time get harder and more expensive to make. It shouldn't start with "we need this now" and end with "why are you saying this will take so long" — then you've failed as a software leader.
